Yes, embracing impermanence is a powerful practice in Taoism that can help you reduce stress and anxiety in daily life. Here are some tips on how to let go of attachment to things that are temporary:

1. Mindfulness practice: Paying attention to your thoughts is the first step in letting go of attachment. When you notice yourself getting attached to something, acknowledge it, and let it go. Try to stay in the present moment without dwelling on the past or worrying about the future.

2. Practice gratitude: Focusing on what you have instead of what you don't have can help you appreciate the present and let go of attachment to things that are temporary. You can make a list of things you appreciate every day, which will help you shift your focus to the positive things in your life.

3. Simplify your life: Simplifying your life can help you let go of attachment to material possessions. Get rid of things you don't need and focus on what is essential to you. This will help you appreciate what you have and let go of attachment to things that are temporary.

4. Embrace change: Change is a natural part of life, and it's essential to learn to embrace it. Recognize that everything is impermanent and that it is okay to let go of things when the time comes. Accepting change will help you let go of attachment to things that are temporary.

5. Let go of the need to control: Trying to control everything in your life can leave you feeling stressed and anxious. Accept that you can't control everything, and let go of the need to do so. This will help you let go of attachment to things that are temporary.

By practicing these tips, you can let go of attachment to things that are temporary, and embrace a more harmonious and peaceful life.
